timeline.message:
Clarify exposing Items

Make it more clear that users do not need to expose Items for integration with Alexa or Google Assistant, only IFTTT. Also mention that the feature is turned off anyway.

Signed off by Richard Koshak: rlkoshak@gmail.com

timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.author: ozirissp

replies.bodyText:
There is a post on the forum explaining how to set up your own instance of OCS and link it with IFTTT. https://community.openhab.org/t/how-to-integrate-custom-openhab-cloud-with-ifttt/79237
There was an announcement on the forum and several posts about it and there is an open issue (last time I checked) on the repo. But the docs never were updated, in my case, under the assumption that it would be fixed quickly. Since it wasn't fixed quickly (understandably given what the fix involves) I see a steady stream of users like @ozirissp who run into all sorts of trouble. Even worse are those Alexa and GA users who try to expose their Items for that integration needlessly, accomplishing nothing beyond exacerbating the problem which caused it to be turned off in the first place. My thought was to add the warning about not exposing Items for Alexa and GA and that it's currently turned off, and then when it gets turned back on to update the docs again.
